intro: Raphionacme moyalica, commonly known as the Moyalica grass, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Uruguay. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of grasses. Raphionacme moyalica is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
